title: Georgian House Hotel announces exciting appointment in their quest for five-star status
text:
Georgian House Hotel announces exciting appointment in their quest for five-star status Georgian House Hotel announces exciting appointment in their quest for five-star status Details Category: Hotel Created on Tuesday, 13 October 2015 10:10 Georgian House, the 60 bedroom family-run boutique hotel in London’s Victoria, has announced the appointment of Adam Rowledge as its new General Manager. Awarded a Master Innholder scholarship on the Cranfield Talent Development Programme in 2015 and an Acorn Award in 2012, Adam will utilise his varied and prestigious experience to help propel Georgian House in achieving their target of five-star status. 
Prior to his appointment at Georgian House, Adam has had an impressive and varied career in the hospitality industry. Starting his career at Hotel Du Vin in Henley-on-Thames in 2007, he then took the position of front of house manager at Hand Picked Hotels’ Nutfield Priory Hotel and Spa before moving to South Lodge Hotel in March 2011. Adam joins the Georgian House Hotel from his most recent position as General Manager at Bannatyne Spa Hotel in Hastings. On his appointment as General Manager Adam says: “I am delighted to be joining the hotel at such an exciting time and look forward to leading the team at Georgian House and continuing the excellent work that has been done so far in developing the product and service that we offer to the highest standards.” Speaking of the hotel’s newest recruit Serena von der Heyde, Owner, added: “Adam joins us at a critical and exciting time. The hotel has just undergone an extensive design refresh and we have recently added two Enchanted Chambers to complement our infamous Wizard Chambers. We are thrilled to have Adam in the team and look forward to seeing what he brings to the hotel to ensure we continue to go from strength to strength.” Related articles
